聽住，其實港鐵係一間上市公司。政府擁有7成股份。

雖然政府擁有7成股份，但唔應該利用呢個身份幫手打壓示威，

元朗721打人：列車司機故意停留係元朗站一陣，打開道門任由鄉黑打人，只有政府（港鐵決策層）先至落到命令。


811畀警察入去太古，荃灣噴催淚彈。

831埋伏。


多次運兵，畀黑警入閘內。

要求法庭出禁制令，禁止示威者堵塞港鐵。

其實代表緊政府借私人公司既殼協助打壓示威。


係外國眼中咁樣係唔得，一間私人公司鐵路應該以乘客安全第一，但港鐵冇咁做。
證明佢唔係私人公司主導，完全係睇政府頭。

香港政府係港鐵最大股東，共產黨係香港政府背後話事人。有理由共產黨
借港鐵海外營運，入侵外國鐵路，掌控埋外國鐵路資源。唔好唔記得港鐵有CCTV，如果海外港鐵都裝，可能將資料分分鐘傳返大陸。


所以，要解釋香港示威者點解要針對港鐵，仲要國際層面上叫外國提防。

replies.msg:
Hong Kong MTR (The Mass Transit Railway) is a major public transport network serving Hong Kong citizens. It should be a neutral and independent corporation but regarding recent issues, in connection with assisting Hong Kong government to suppress protests, reveal that MTR has been politized and government-controlled instead of operating independently.

On the night of 21 July, a group of gangsters in white shirts stormed into rural MTR station, Yuen Long station, and assaulted train passengers with pipes, poles and other objects. Passengers had sought help from regional police force but were abandoned. This incident, also called Yuen Long terrorist Attack, eventually left at least 45 people injured. There is an outrageous point causing the attack that the driver had told passengers left the carriage and suspended to close the doors of carriage after the train arrived Yuen Long station. Such a move allowed those gangsters to have enough time to attack innocent people outside the train.

On 13/8 , In Kwai Chung station, protesters began gathering at the police station at around 9pm,. Some protesters hurled projectiles at the building, but retreated when riot police arrived. As protesters moved towards the Kwai Fong MTR station, police officers gave chase. In an unprecedented move, officers entered the station and fired tear gas into the paid concourse area, in contravention of the tear gas manufacturer’s warnings. A few days later, there was another similar incident happened in Tai Koo station, A Hong Kong police officer was seen shooting pepper balls at close range against protesters on Sunday as protestors were leaving the scene via Tai Koo MTR station.

On 23 and 24 August, Hong Kong MTR shuts 4 stations and 3 stations around legal protest in Kwun Tong and Tusen Wan respectively. The move comes after days of pressure from Chinese state media outlets, who accuse the transit firm of assisting anti-government protesters.

31/8, Hong Kong police force rushed into MTR again and assaulted civilians at Price Edward Station. They shot tear gas in the train. More terribly, Hong Kong police force seemed more like offenders, instead of law enforces. Hong Kong police committed crimes of indiscriminate attacks. More footage on the random assaulted aftermath of police assault. A young man was injured and a person on wheelchair was attacked by the police and shed blood on his back. MTR was required to response this issue but they claimed Hong Kong


There were signs that, MTR as a private corporation, seemingly assisted in police force and gangs to trap and beat up protestors, as well as to repress legal protests.
Passenger safety is the priority in railways operations in Hong Kong, and even the world. Obviously, MTR is a failed in security and became an unneutral private corporation which was suspected of being politized and becoming “a public-private corporation”( it means a private corporation controlled by totalitarian Hong Kong government).

If MTR were government-based, the head leader of MTR would have stepped down due to recent chaos occurred. However, MTR, which its largest shareholder is Hong Kong government, disguises a limited corporation to assist totalitarian government in repressing protestors. In short, MTR serves totalitarian government.

我只寫到政府解港鐵殼打壓示威者。

Hong Kong has flagrantly been helping Communist China to export the regime's authoritarian corporate management modality. I'll depend on you to spread this awareness and understanding as widely as possible. The international community needs to be informed about this, and shareholders of the Hong Kong Mass Transit Railway corporation (MTR) be alerted that the corporation's modus operandi is detrimental to its prospects of profit and reputation. The recent conduct of the MTR during the anti-extradition protests is proof of its complete failure to operate as an independent corporation and an unveiling of the authoritarian face of Hong Kong's neoliberalism.
Holding 75.28% of shares, the Hong Kong Government is the largest shareholder of the MTR. The recent conduct of the MTR in managing its services such as -- halting trains, disrupting services, closing up stations, permitting triad members entry to carriages to assault passengers and police to fire tear gas inside confined station areas -- have proven to the world that the company's management has been complicit with the Hong Kong police and the triad thugs in the criminal activity of beating up citizens, threatening safety of passengers. Such appalling acts perpetrated by a public transport corporation, which is supposed to maintain the rightful stance of neutrality, has led people to suspect it to be a politicized corporation under the direct control of an authoritarian government.
Owing to the corruption of the Hong Kong political parties and legal sector, the MTR is protected from class action litigation and the scourge of massive recompense caused by the event of permitting gangsters to attack passengers in the train compartments at the Yuen Long station, and the other event of permitting the police to fire tear gas inside a train station (the plutocrats may rest assured that the Pan-democrats' 20 million dollars collected from fundraising will not be used for this sort of lawsuit).
If the MTR had maintained its identity as a state-owned corporation run by the government, the Secretary for Transport would have already been dismissed. But disguising as a commercial company with a subcontractor-like identity, the MTR has succeeded to evade responsibility, faking innocence. It can even apply for injunction to ban protesters from entry. Unable to do the same, government departments can do nothing to keep protesters away. This is the reason the formation of a subcontractor-like commercial company favors authoritarian rule.
In the 90s, Hong Kong public services were outsourced exactly to prepare the way for today's authoritarian rule. So, we now witness the MTR, airport and hospitals all fail to provide reliable, neutral public services, while functioning as a cat's paw for the government. If the staffs of the MTR, airport, schools and hospitals are not hired on contracts but still as permanent civil servants as in the past, they would not shy away from responsibility as much as they do now or would they appear so much to be supporters of the communist regime.
This seemingly politicized public corporation has operations in both China and other countries. Its profitability and reputation will certainly be affected by the conduct of its head office in Hong Kong, for which, if you are a shareholder of the company, you have every right to call the board of directors to account. If you find the MTR has operations overseas, you should notify these countries' transport departments and congresspersons of the MTR's outrageous conduct.

This is the strategy of struggle for Hong Kong as an international city-state. In tune with the international world of rational conduct, our city is an advanced society with a professional spirit and a meticulous attitude, while all that the communist party knows is giving orders to wicked cops, underworld syndicates and corrupt departments. As long as we have a mastery of the skills acquired over the past 170 something years of operating an advanced city-state, the communist bandits from the mountain fortresses and cave dwellings will be no rivals to us. At the end, they will cede the autonomous rule of Hong Kong to us. Thereafter, just as what the former British government (1842-1997) had done, we would be 'ruling' the communist party according to Hong Kong institutions and conventions, doing a perfectly good job to gladden the heart of the guest as well as that of the host.
It is worth your while to inform the US trade agreement negotiating authority of the cases of Hong Kong's public corporations. This will help enlighten the US on the Hong Kong situation that -- if universal suffrage is not achieved in Hong Kong, and if Hong Kong no longer follows the international standard of rational management, Hong Kong will become Communist China's legal hub for the expansion of the regime's authoritarianism to the outside world.
---- My apologies for having written an academic piece of work, which may be a bit hard to understand. But it takes a bit more learning for us HongKongers to be successful in our struggle against the communists. We are not engaged in mud wrestling with the Chinese Communist Party. We don't play them at their level but higher. From Wan Chin's manuscript of 'Hegemony of Hong Kong-style neoliberalism'
